Praticamente todo mundo conhece KF
Mas para quem não conhece, ta ai minha recomendação...
Este jogo é super divertido, mas ele literalmente é sem graça se você jogar sozinho, então certifique-se de ter amigos xD
O jogo se baseia em Waves(ondas) de mutantes(não são zumbis) que vem em sua direção com sangue nos olhos.
Seu único objetivo é sobreviver e chegar até a ultima Wave e matar o Patriarch(Boss)
O jogo conta com 6 classes diferentes, com suas próprias armas e habilidades de combate.
É um jogo com muita ação e que se torna extremamente difícil com o passar das waves, ele realmente pode te trazer uma desafio de verdade.
No final das contas... Eu Recomendo! =)

When I first played Killing Floor, I thought - 'Here we go, just another survival horror trying to be Left For Dead'. However, the more I played it the more I realised how great the game was.

Whether you want to be a hack 'n' slash beserker, a madman with a flamethrower, tactical sharpshooter, close range support specialist, generalist commando, explosives wielding maniac or the much needed field medic, KF gives players a diverse range of classes in which to dispatch of the enemy hordes. Each of these classes allows for destruction in their own unique way, however the game really shines when teamwork is utilised. The more I played it, the more I realised that either play together or it is likely you will die alone getting your face bitten off by a Clot or some other twisted version of a science experiment gone wrong.

Not only does KF offer a great range of potential classes to play, but a diverse range of enemies to massacre. These range from the common slow moving Clot or the obese vomiting Bloat, to a mad chainsaw wielding Scrake or the final dreaded Patriarch, with plenty more to be discovered between waves. KF provides players with enemies that are better suited to certain player classes, especially as the difficulty and map duration goes up. This really solidifies the need for teamwork.

The graphics aren't the best by today's standards, but it is the gameplay that draws you in to the extent that you won't care about them anyway. Furthermore, KF is a great LAN game not only for the team based aspect or that it is easy to pick up and play, but for the fact that it can be run on fairly low spec PC's so pretty much any player can get involved. Another cool aspect I think is that at Halloween and Christmas KF have previously released themed units and maps. This may be a little gimmicky for some, but I enjoy 'slaying' twisted Santas' minions, ha.....

One of the only real criticisms I have of the game is that you are limited to 6 players in matches without steamworkshop contributions. This is a bit of a pain, especially at a lan, but it can be worked around. Another thing that can get a little repetitive after hours of play is the player narration. “can't you see i'm reloading”, “i'm trying to heal you not shag you”. While funny at first, it can get on your nerves.

Never the less, taking all the above into account, and the fact that it goes on sale so frequently at below $5, I believe that it is worth your time, money and the addition slot in your steam library. Achievement hunters, lan enthusiats, casual players and those hardcore individual looking for a challenge will all find KF to be worth your investment.

Killing floor is one hell of a game, very good, lots of guns and 7 perks to choose, From Medic to demolition.
Difficulty from Beginner (Aka, Zeds dont even know you exist) to Hell On Earth.. Comes with some nice character's DLCs From steampunk to outbreak, even some weapons DLC (Which some arent really cheap to be just a lil gun), New GameMode, objective mode ..

Self Opinion: Dont buy the golden weapons pack and some of those useless DLCs, some servers are down but atleast alot of people still play, oh and dont buy when its fully price, sometimes there is sales that make killing floor cost 10 - 5 Bucks, you will be saving alot.

There is one primary thing that makes KIlling Floor so great. It's not the story, (there isn't one), it's not the graphics (this is an old unreal engine game), and it's not really even the idea behind the game itself. Killing zombies isn't exactly orginal. However, there is something very special about the shooting mechanics of this game. The shooting is so goddamn fluid that you will just want to shoot your guns for the heck of it. Coupled with the excellent gore and dismemberment of zombies, it is an absolute thrill to pump round after round into zombies and let loose pounds of lead downrange. I struggle to think of a game where I enjoy the actual shooting as much as this one. If this is on sale buy it no questions asked.

Купил игру пока была акция,думал ну так чуток время убью,а на самом деле подсел и подсодил своих друзей.
В игре есть различные виды классов начаная с медика и заканчивая огнемётчиком,различные модельки персонажей и редактор карт. Правда маловато видов зомби или мутантов (сам ещё не понял кто они) ,но у каждого из них свои умения и они легко могут выносить вашу группу. И ещё напригает то что если друг играт на каком-то сервере и даже если он там один,то не факт что вы сможите подключиться (порой напрягает искать общий сервер особенно если вас 3-6) В целом игру советую всем любителям по стрелять и навалять Английским монстрам,покупайте и не пожалеите.

1 Хорошо реализованы принципы командной игры 
2 Интересная задумка с прокачкой и специализацией персонажей 
3  Попадаются любопытные разновидности зомби

-game created by people who aren't even fans of the zombie genre. none of the maps are inspired by any zombie related areas. just random places that get boring after 20 min. also not really zombies but mutants

-high rank players enjoy to watch low ranks die as they on purpose dont help with any zombies until the low ranks are dead first. 

-players get their high ranks through hacking. so none of them even have respect or skill.

-high ranks use guns that flash on your screen to blind you and stop you from whatever little progress you could be making

-impossible to actually lvl up in this game and unlock better weapons b/c high ranks are so OP they steal 99% of all the kills. even on the hardest waves. the exp system only gives exp to kills, so you could damage a million zombies and still make zilch experience.

-there is no community every1 hates each other. it ruins the purpose of having a team-based co-op game.

You are in central london, dropped off to try and clear out a hive of biological freaks hellbent on destroying humanity... You are down to your last mag... Luckily, You are not alone... 
Fight Un relenting hordes of flesh hungry mutant zombies that want nothing more that to make you regret the day you were born. 
Buy weapons from a flirtatious and mysterious trader girl with one hell of a sassy attitude.

And do all you can to take down that patriarch... Your future lies on the Horizine...

It seems like a Left 4 Dead clone but actually it's so much more. 

The game has you surviving waves of zombies in massive maps. In between each wave you can spend money you earned on weapons. The game has many more weapons than Left 4 Dead and the variety of the weapons is incredible. There are a multitude of maps to try out. It's very fun to try out different weapon combos. 

This game is HARD, the game adds in more enemies as more people join. The zombies can jump off roof tops and pounce on you from just about any angle. The shooting is also very realistic. There is no targeting reticle and when you move you lose accuracy. If you try to shoot randomly, you will undoubtedly miss a whiole ton of shots and waste your very limited ammo. This makes the game more about positioning and strategy then mechanics. You will have to think about which doors to weld and which pathways to defend.

Also this will run on just about everything.  Its actually bizzare how well optimized it is. This isn't Crysis but considering how how detailed and large the maps are, its amazing.

I still don't know if this is my family trying to speak to me in very nebulous metaphors or it's my therapist trying to end my life. 


Either way, I still will continue to gut these puss-bags like they're my siblings. :^)
